result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph M Conley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court has no objection to early discharge after 1 year if all conditions met.

Concurrent with: with 15CF40.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall not possess any alcohol or illegal substances.
Defendant shall not possess any drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.
Defendant shall have no contact directly or indirectly with Michael Mapes, Jeffrey Faulks or their families.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall take prescription medication in the manner and method as prescribed.
Defendant shall use only one (1) pharmacy.
Defendant shall notify Agent of new medications or changes, within 48 hours.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
